intro: Argocoffeopsis afzelii, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries containing a single seed. It is often found in forested areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and potential economic importance, it is of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
